communication
Class RMIServerHandler

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      communication.ServerHandler
          communication.RMIServerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
communication.ClientInterface, java.lang.Runnable, java.rmi.Remote, logging.Loggable
public class RMIServerHandler
extends ServerHandler

Overview

The RMIServerHandler class is an concrete class that handle the communication with the server using the Remote Method Invocation. Most of its methods implements the method of the parent class.

Responsibilities

This class must give the client the possibility to make requests to the server and obtain responses.
For this reason, it must define the legal requests that the client can perform and must store some information about the server status or notifications and implements them.

Collaborators

This class is called very often by the client GUI, so its collaborators are ClientMainWindow, CreationSpeciesDialog, RegistrationDialog, WaitingRoomWindow, and GameManager and in general by all the classes that needs to communicate with the server.

Version:
1.0
Author:
RAA

getInstance

public static RMIServerHandler getInstance()

confirmTurn

public final void confirmTurn()
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                              exceptions.InvalidTokenException,
                              exceptions.NegativeResponseException,
                              exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException
Description copied from class: ServerHandler
The method confirmTurn request the server to let the player confirm his/her turn. If the request can be accepted and processed, the function ends normally without any return value, otherwise, an exception is thrown.

Specified by:
confirmTurn in class ServerHandler
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a connection error
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if there is no connection error but the request takes too long to be executed
exceptions.InvalidTokenException - if the client has an invalid token no more accepted by the server
exceptions.NegativeResponseException - if the request simply cannot be accepted
exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException - if the player is not in game
See Also:
GameManager, SocketServerHandler, RMIServerHandler

createSpecies

public final void createSpecies(java.lang.String theSpeciesName,
                                java.lang.String theSpeciesType)
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                exceptions.NameAlreadyTakenException,
                                exceptions.SpeciesAlreadyCreatedException,
                                exceptions.InvalidTokenException
Description copied from class: ServerHandler
The method createSpecies request the server to let the player create a new species. If the request can be accepted and processed, the function ends normally without any return value, otherwise, an exception is thrown.

Specified by:
createSpecies in class ServerHandler
Parameters:
theSpeciesName - is the name of the species the user wants to create. It must be an alphanumeric character
theSpeciesType - is the type of the species the user wants to create. It must be "e" for a herbivore species or "c" for a carnivorous species.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a connection error
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if there is no connection error but the request takes too long to be executed
exceptions.NameAlreadyTakenException - if there is already one species created by the user with the same name
exceptions.SpeciesAlreadyCreatedException - if the player already has one species (only one species could be owned at time)
exceptions.InvalidTokenException - if the client has an invalid token no more accepted by the server
See Also:
GameManager, SocketServerHandler, RMIServerHandler

disconnect

public final void disconnect()
Description copied from class: ServerHandler
The method connect tries to safely break a connection with the server. In every case, the method doesn't throw exception, neither if there are some connection problems (because if there were the client could not do anything to repair them).

Specified by:
disconnect in class ServerHandler
See Also:
GameManager, SocketServerHandler, RMIServerHandler

exceptions.SpeciesNotCreatedException - if the user wants to enter the game without owning any species
exceptions.InvalidTokenException - if the client has an invalid token no more accepted by the server
exceptions.GameAccessDeniedException - if the server cannot let the user enter for an unspecified reason

growDinosaur

public final void growDinosaur(java.lang.String theDinosaurID)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                               java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                               exceptions.InvalidDinosaurIDException,
                               exceptions.MaxSizeReachedException,
                               exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException,
                               exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException,
                               exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException,
                               exceptions.InvalidTokenException,
                               exceptions.StarvationDeathException
Description copied from class: ServerHandler
The method growDinosaur requests the server to let a dinosaur grow in size. If the request can be accepted and processed, the function ends normally without any return value, otherwise, an exception is thrown.

Specified by:
growDinosaur in class ServerHandler
Parameters:
theDinosaurID - is the ID of the dinosaur to let grow
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a connection error
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if there is no connection error but the request takes too long to be executed
exceptions.InvalidDinosaurIDException - if the dinosaur ID given is not valid
exceptions.MaxSizeReachedException - if the dinosaur has already reached its maximum size
exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException - if the player is not gui.ingame
exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException - if the player is not owning the current turn
exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException - if the dinosaur has already reached its maximum number of moves per turn
exceptions.InvalidTokenException - if the client has an invalid token no more accepted by the server
exceptions.StarvationDeathException - if the dinosaur dies while trying to perform this action
See Also:
GameManager, SocketServerHandler, RMIServerHandler

handleServerDisconnection

protected final void handleServerDisconnection(java.io.IOException theException)
Description copied from class: ServerHandler
The method handleServerDisconnection handles the unexpected server disconnections. It reset all the settings in order to let the ServerHandler reconnect later with the server.

Specified by:
handleServerDisconnection in class ServerHandler
Parameters:
theException - is the exception that has been throwned by a failed operations with the server
See Also:
SocketServerHandler, RMIServerHandler

moveDinosaur

public final void moveDinosaur(java.lang.String theDinosaurID,
                               util.Position theDestination)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                               java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                               exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException,
                               exceptions.StarvationDeathException,
                               exceptions.InvalidDestinationException,
                               exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException,
                               exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException,
                               exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException,
                               exceptions.FightLostException,
                               exceptions.FightWonException
Description copied from class: ServerHandler
The method moveDinosaur requests the server to let a dinosaur move around in the map. If the request can be accepted and processed, the function ends normally without any return value, otherwise, an exception is thrown.

Specified by:
moveDinosaur in class ServerHandler
Parameters:
theDinosaurID - is the ID of the dinosaur that the player wants to move
theDestination - is the final position that the dinosaur has to occupy at the end of the action
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a connection error
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if there is no connection error but the request takes too long to be executed
exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException - if the dinosaur ID of the dinosaur that has to be moved is not valid
exceptions.StarvationDeathException - if the dinosaur dies while trying to make the move
exceptions.InvalidDestinationException - if the dinosaur is to be placed on a not valid position
exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException - if the player is not gui.ingame
exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException - if the player is not owning the current turn
exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException - if the dinosaur has reached its maximum moves per turn
exceptions.FightLostException - if the dinosaur had to fight during the move and has lost the fight
exceptions.FightWonException - if the dinosaur had to fight during the move and has won the fight
See Also:
GameManager, SocketServerHandler, RMIServerHandler
